explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being inorganic compounds containing oxygen

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 3,241mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 2,660mg/kg, 5,140mg/kg, 3,160mg/kg, 3,450mg/kg, 4,080mg/kg and 5,000mg/kg (DFGOT vol.5 (1993)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin irritation tests (exposure duration unknown) (CERI Hazard Data 2001-30 (2002)): "At 24 and 72 hours, moderate irritation was noted."

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description of the human health effects (ATSDR (1992) and ACGIH (7th, 2005)): The substance irritates the human eye (though the severity of the effects and recovery period are not presented). Although classified into Category 2A-2B, it should be placed in Category 2A from the viewpoint of safety if further subclassification is needed.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: No data available

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in NTP DB (Access on Apr., 2006), ECETOC TR63 (1995), CERI Hazard Data 2001-42 (2002) and ACGIH (7th, 2005).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A4 (as inorganic borate compounds) by ACGIH (2005).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the evidence of adverse effects on reproduction of parental animals and development of pups at doses producing no parental toxicity, described in NTP DB (Access on May, 2006), CERI Hazard Data 2001-30 (2002).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (nervous system, gastrointestinal tract), Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "GI effects such as nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain and diarrhea, and central nerve effects such as lethargy, headaches, fever, increased irritability and muscle convulsion" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-30 (2002)), "irritation of the upper respiratory tract" (ATSDR (1992)), and the evidence from animal studies including "cyanosis, tetany, spasm and shock-like symptoms" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-30 (2002)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "oliguresis, anuria, and nephropathy including renal tubular necrosis" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-30 (2002)).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 96 hours LC50=78.1mg boron/L(Boric Acid Equivalent: 447mg/L) of the fish (Rainbow Trout) (EHC204, 1998).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was not water-insolubility (the water-solubility =50000mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), and acute toxicity was low, it was classified into Not classified.
